title: Y'know what would balance Yasuo?
body:
A delay on his wall like Veigar's stun.

An ability that can instantly block an ultimate, even if it's on his character model, is busted.

replies.body: I would suggest that it doesn't get wider from the rank 1 width.

In my humble opinion, he should keep everything but lose the shield on his passive. Either that or take away his ability to retain massive amounts of sustain while he crits. There is absolutely nothing keeping Yasuo honest and punishing him for over aggressive plays. With either of these two options then he has be a little bit more respectful and intelligent about what moves he makes so as to not be punished.
Nope, they should remove his double crits passive. If he wants to build crits, he can. If he wants to build AD/Tank, he can. Maybe make AD increase crit damage or something IDK.

Don't forget that Kayle's augmented auto attacks bypass wind wall altogether.

On a more serious note. I think one way to make it seem a little bit more balanced in game but would be more annoying on the technical side would be have Wind Wall (and by extension braums shield as well) only block a projectile if the leading side of the projectile hitbox collides the wind wall hitbox.

To illustrate:

Y: Yasuo
==: Projectile
|: Wind Wall
x: blocked projectile

Yas casts WW in the middle of the projectile
Y     ==
Y   =|=
Y ==|
Projectile not blocked

Yas casts WW in front of a projectile
Y     ==
Y   |==
Y   |x
Blocked

This would force yas players to try to predict where the projectile is going to come from and have WW up before it gets to close. At the same time rewards players for landing abilities that at the moment are getting blocked because the trailing end of the projectiles hitbox collides with the WW that was just cast even though most of the project is already behind it.

I agree with this,

It is incredibly frustrating when playing Aurelion Sol, (who's biggest counter is already Yasuo) 
and having a lane-wide stun vanish instantly because one side of it just nicked the edge of the wind wall.

Or at a smaller scale, if the majority of the stun is already on top of Yasuo and you're about to press Q again, but he wind walls and the wall catches the tail end of the particle (even if the middle of the stun is passed where the wind wall spawns), and the whole thing fizzles.
I am a nami main and I tried to ult a Yasuo from a right angle, (literally 0% of the wind wall was facing my tidal wave) and still didn't get through =-\

As much as I cant stand Yasuo! I agree with Knuuckles, its the quick reactions of blocking an Ez or Jinx ult or screwing up a LB combo that make it such an interesting ability. 

With a delay, jinx and Ezreal would never have their ult blocked, it basically wouldnt affect champs like LB and ahri, as their whole combo would be quicker than the delay in the wall. 
Its a great idea, and good thinking! but i think it would take away everything that the ability is.
As an alternative, i would suggest that the wall continues blocking projectile abilities, but Auto attacks still go through it (with some damage reduction of course) that way ADC's wouldn't just be free meals handed to him on a platter anymore.

also there needs to be a hard think about what abilities do and don't go through the wall, examples being:

**Thresh's Q:** if his auto attacks go through the wall, why doesn't his Q? they are exactly the same (in terms of physics), he throws a hook at you and pulls it back. (either both should go through the wall, or none of them should)

**Fiora's W:** She is holding the sword and thrusting it at him. In no way at all does that classify as a 'projectile'. if that counts then RIP all melee champs with swords and spears.

**Braum's R:** Braum creates a 'fissure'. A 'fissure' doesn't actually consist of anything, its a hole in the ground, it has no physical matter that can be blocked. 

**Fiddlesticks' E and Azir's W:** Both are living (or dead in the case of Azir) organisms, that are propelled by their own propulsion (Azir's soldiers run, and fiddle's crow flies) neither of them are 'thrown' or 'launched' so they cant be projectiles. Plus if it blocks the crow, then in theory it should block anivia's movement.

So yea, if you want to make it a wall that blocks 'projectiles' my advice to riot would be to look up the definition of 'projectile' first.

Personally id just give him mana and take away his armour shred, but thats just me.

but good idea, (Upvote from me!)

On another note, for certain matchups it's not really viable to play around the windwall since the abilities it's used to block often have around the same cd as windwall; but I don't see why people don't counterpick yasou more since there are alot of hard counters that can make it very difficult for even a good yasou to outplay you.
